subject: Technology
title: Humanoid Robots: Why Build Them Like Us?
description: Learn Humanoid Robots: Why Build Them Like Us? in one minute.

hook.text: Our world is built for human bodies: stairs, doors, handles, chairs. A humanoid robot fits right in.

buildup.text: Boston Dynamics' Atlas can run, jump, and do backflips. Tesla's Optimus aims to be an affordable household helper.

discovery.text: Humanoid design lets robots use human tools, navigate human spaces, and interact naturally with people.

twist.text: Humanoid robots are incredibly hard to build. Walking on two legs is one of the most complex engineering challenges.

climax.text: Many experts argue wheels are more practical. But humans want robots that look like us, even if wheels are better.

punchline.text: We build humanoid robots because our world was built for humans.

quiz.question: Why do engineers build humanoid robots?
options: Our world is designed for human-shaped bodies
Wheels haven't been invented for robots yet
